channel.title: Haade
channel.description: Home Assistance Alsace home automation & electronics.

item.title: TrueNAS Scale OS Update: The Best NAS Manager of the Moment!
item.dc:creator: Nico
item.description:
TrueNAS scale is reaching maturity and is announcing major advances that now allow me to leave OMV, my old NAS manager.

How time flies! It’s been over a year now since I last looked at the embedded system for Nas, TrueNAS. As you know, few open source operating systems are dedicated to Nas, personally I only see two that are valid Openmediavault and TrueNAS (formerly Freenas). To get back to the [...]

Read the full article: TrueNAS Scale OS Update: The Best NAS Manager of the Moment! on the blog Haade.fr.

item.title: Hikvision DS-KV8x13 Doorphone Review
item.dc:creator: Nico
item.description:
Testing and integration of the Hikvision DS-KV8X13 doorphone with full integration into Jome Assistant

As part of a installation for access control in a town hall and already automated with Home Assistant, I bought a complete Hikvision kit because the price is attractive and I already know that I could control everything in Home Assistant.

Read the full article: Hikvision DS-KV8x13 Doorphone Review on the blog Haade.fr.

item.title: Cam Slim VS Gen 2 Sonoff Comparison
item.dc:creator: Nico
item.description:
Comparison of the two Sonoff cameras of the moment Cam Slim and Cam Slim Gen 2 so which one to choose?

Today, let’s compare the two currently available Sonoff cameras for less than €30 from all our affiliated retailers. I’d like to thank Domadoo and Itead for providing me with this equipment.

Read the full article: Cam Slim VS Gen 2 Sonoff Comparison on the blog Haade.fr.

item.title: Tado° which starter kit should I choose?
item.dc:creator: Nico
item.description:
Comparison of the two starter kits from the Tado° brand, here is an article presenting the equipment and helping you in your choice when purchasing, the starter kits are essential to use the Tado° heating management in the Tado° application

After presenting the sumptuous Tado° X thermostatic faucet, as well as the most successful Tado app, Now let’s get to the heart of the system. Today, I’m going to introduce you to the two Tado° controllers: the Wireless Smart Thermostat X and the Smart Thermostat X. These two controllers feature [...]

Read the full article: Tado° which starter kit should I choose? on the blog Haade.fr.

item.title: Automate Bubendorff roller shutters in Zigbee for cheap
item.dc:creator: Nico
item.description:
Let's not be fooled by the title, I'm not really going to automate Bubendorff shutters but replace the system with Chamberlain wired motors. I'll give you my reasons

Today I’m not explaining to you how I automated Bubendorff shutters in Zigbee, simply because it’s not possible, but why I decided to remove the Bubendorff Tradi ID 1 system which was 20 years old by Chamberlain wired motors with mechanical limit switch connected to a Zigbee Moes switch.

Read the full article: Automate Bubendorff roller shutters in Zigbee for cheap on the blog Haade.fr.

item.title: Testing the Tado° heating interface
item.dc:creator: Nico
item.description:
Second step of presentation of the Tado universe, I will show you the whole process of using the Tado interface and its particularities

Here is a continuation of the presentation of the Tado° universe following the presentation of the Tado° X thermostatic faucet, Today I will introduce you to the Tado° application, its special features and especially what differentiates the management of Tado° Heating and management from other brands.

Read the full article: Testing the Tado° heating interface on the blog Haade.fr.

item.title: Install a connected LED strip DIY with WLED
item.dc:creator: Math
item.description:
I will show you how to easily install a Gledopto GL-C-310WL LED strip in home assistant thanks to WLED installed by default in the module, child's play

In order to light up the coffee niche in my kitchen, I decided to make my own LED strip using WLED. WLED connects to your Wifi and is natively recognized by Home Assistant, it allows you to use an addressable LED strip and offers many programming possibilities, I explain in [...]

Read the full article: Install a connected LED strip DIY with WLED on the blog Haade.fr.

item.title: Tado° X Smart Thermostatic Faucet Review
item.dc:creator: Nico
item.description:
Close to perfection this Tado X faucet and I can't wait to present it to you, in this article I will just present the Tado X thermostatic faucet compatible with Thread

The company Tado° kindly provided me with the entire Tado° X range. But in this article I will simply present the Tado° X thermostatic tap. Talking about the entire Tado° range in one article does not seem relevant to me because there is a lot to say!. In order not [...]

Read the full article: Tado° X Smart Thermostatic Faucet Review on the blog Haade.fr.

item.title: Setting up Zigbee/Thread Multi-protocol on Home Assistant
item.dc:creator: Nico
item.description:
Thread is a protocol that is gaining momentum, it is possible thanks to Silicon Labs to make Thread/Matter coexist with Zigbee on the same EZSP key. Despite the experimental operation, you will be able to realize that the installation of both protocols on the same key is possible!

After a tutorial on installing the Thread/Matter protocol on Home Assistant, let’s continue now and tackle a sensitive subject, the thread/zigbee multi-protocol on the same key. Why sensitive, this integration is still in the development phase and not recommended by the Nabu Casa team.

Read the full article: Setting up Zigbee/Thread Multi-protocol on Home Assistant on the blog Haade.fr.

item.title: Prepare a Thread and Matter network on Home Assistant
item.dc:creator: Nico
item.description:
Discover and prepare a Thread edge router with matter to integrate new products coming to the market with Home Assistant, Thread an exceptional protocol

Many articles are available on the Matter connected product management protocol, currently it works with the Wifi network or the Thread network. We know all the advantages and disadvantages of wifi, but have you ever heard about Thread?

Read the full article: Prepare a Thread and Matter network on Home Assistant on the blog Haade.fr.
